item.content:encoded:
In this episode, Micah Redding talks to James Hughes about cyber-Buddhism, religious transhumanism, and the longevity dividend. Read our detailed notes here.

  • The "rapture of the nerds", Christian millennialism, and the good apocalypse

  • "Smug atheists should read more science fiction" - Charlie Jane Anders
  • What religious transhumanists can do for the world
  • "Without a vision, the people perish" - Proverbs 29:18

  • More about Amy Gaskin and Micah Redding

  • Transhumanism's conflicted feelings about spirituality
  • The history of the word transhumanism

  • Christianity is about resurrection, not escapism
  • Heaven is not my home - NT Wright

  • Humanity+
  • The Christian Transhumanist Association
  • Further up! Further in!

"Transhumanism is at heart altruistic. You are not working for your own account. It's not about salivating upon hearing of a new technological consumer gadget or even trying to achieve personal immortality. You work for all, for a future with more options, more freedom, more safety, less hunger, less poverty, less death. Ultimately it's about creating a world with more good and less bad in it." - Koen De Paus
